title: Silver Serpants = Noob trap?
body:
So after a few games playing Gangplank in my usual style after his rework (As in, not considering SS stacks out right) I decided to try to play him like Nasus stacking his SS stacks instead of Q stacks. Since before I'd not been able to get enough SS to upgrade his ult in a game. It seemed to end too fast but I knew it was also bc I wasn't focusing SS stacks.

Then I play a few games like this and realize I am doing WORSE. I am given the option to either use my q to harass enemy champ or last hit a creep to stack SS. Ideally we wanna stack SS to unlock full potential of our ULT for late game. But what I see happening is my lane opponent just harasses and out lanes me. I can last hit under tower and that's fine but I'm more or less NOT THERE. Its' like I have no lane presence, outside of using his TbF passive to trade I must use my mana and my cool down's so I last hit creeps with q, to stack SS. 

But by the time I upgrade my ult the first time, I feel weaker then I ever have with Gp, and my lane opponent comes back with equivilant if not superior items then me and is still ahead in terms of ability to engage in trades confidently in their favor. I feel like the playstyle of stacking his SS for full ult is a trap, as I have better performances playing Gangplank in situations where my q is mostly a Harass tool, using it to enable me to trade more often. 

What do you guys think?


***Edit*** 

That title typo tho?

replies.body: youre supposed to stack it using your barrels. if you last hit the barrel with your parrley and it kills all the creeps you can get up to 50 ss in one go
Barrels aren't reliable thou.  It's basically a rush to see who can kill the barrel first.  Dominant melee champions, and ranged can usually pop barrels before GP is able to.
usually i put a barrel a little bit back where the wave is going to go then when the wave gets near put a barrel in range of the first and instantly detonate
Pretty easy to use if you practice
you have to moderate between farming and harassing with q. Ideally you want to use your barrels to kill multiple minions and harass the enemy.

Just one simple question: What about the barrels? You can detonate them with Q, and the Parrley detonation will collect silver serpents.
Again, I'm just asking a question.

Go at it with a hybrid mentality, not a nasus mentality.  You shouldn't just be focusing on stacking this one ability the entire laning phase.

I would say it's probably better to Q barrels and get harass + multiple stacks simultaneously.

That being said, USE YOUR BARRELS.  Not just to Q stack, use them for everything as much as you can.  They're free and do lotsa damage and you can do some nifty stuff to activate them.  You could put a 'primer' barrel in a bush when your opponent isn't looking, then link another barrel to it and instantly detonate it, without your opponent being able to react.

If I can throw in my 2 cents, I'd say that new GPs E is his most important ability.

This is how I feel about it too. It's a situational choice and you always have to balance if you want to get more gold/SS from Q farm or use the barrels +Q to try and pressure your opponent and get ahead. More games and practice will keep improving the way you can judge each situation.

**OR** you could give him the passive SS generation/ Lower the cost of the upgrades/ grant SS from champion kills

But why?  GP isn't meant to have all 3 upgrades, at least not unless you farm a LOT and the match lasts well over an hour.

They are basically side objectives, a little bonus for farming up well.  I might even argue that they don't matter nearly as much as the passive gold you get from farming with Q.  Once you get enough for one upgrade, you've already got 500 extra gold to itemize with.

Realistically you only get 2 and you don't really need all 3 imo.

Death's Daughter is the only one really worth getting! Raise Morale means you have to use it on your teammates rather your enemies and Fire At Will needs CC to be coupled with it so it even gets to the extra barrages. Farming ain't even worth it tbh.
I find that Fire At Will works well if you are using it to fight in, a great way to have the enemy team panic in a team fight, or ignore it and pay.

It 'can' work well if they choose to stand in it, though most quickly disengage out of it. Death's Daughter gives the R that... Mantheon drop where everyone is like 'OH CRAP' and feels the pain. Fire At Will more or less just makes his R into a 'Don't stand in it for more than a couple of seconds' compared to Death's Daughter that INSTANTLY makes them scatter, or eat a 200+ true damage nuke to the face.
You do get SS from killing champs with Q don't you? I'm pretty sure you get the bonus gold at least.

The only porblem with the new E is that it's super underperforming till level 7 a in lane against a range opponent (when old GP could at least use it to improve his damage in a reliable way)

For SS, i feel like you shouldn't be able to buy the 3 upgrade in a "normal" duration game, so I'm kinda doubtfull about the 1SS/sec that is actually on the pbe for other map.
This just bassicaly give free 3 upgrade ult pass 25 min without any Q minion (and an upgrade in 9 min :s), maybe turn it down to 1 SS/2or 3 sec would be better to match SR

yeah, it does feel a little underwhelming having all this power waved in front of your face and not being able to take it because you need the lane harass. I think it would feel better if you had the three options and could chose one at level 11 and another at level 16. Then your ult upgrades aren't tied to, or rather weighed against, lane harass.
At least for me, early levels mean that I have lower damage on my Q so I just farm with it. I only really use it for harassment when I get some damage items.

Even if you don't get SS, you get extra gold from farming with Q.
It's still worth it.

question: are you using barrels? because if you are then you shouldn't have too many problems.

I think the passive should only apply to champions though. I don't like using it accidentally last hitting when i really want to put it on my enemy.
Champions, Monsters and buildings. Not minions.

Silver Serpent stacking in lane is indeed a trap. The vast majority of your extra last-hits will come from the combination of your Q and your barrels once you have a completed item and can split push a bit. You can get 48-56 Serpents a wave this way. That dwarfs any small benefits you get from passively last-hitting in lane. The Q should still be used to last-hit when necessary, but doing so shouldn't be your primary goal.

Once you can easily clear a wave with the barrels, then you should absolutely be stacking up serpents while split pushing. Before that, it's not really necessary.
I haven't been able to test the new GP out yet, but does his Q still synergize with {{item:3074}} {{item:3025}} {{item:3087}} ?
yes
Which makes clearing waves with Q a dream, so early laning needs to be focused on harass, after building a touch of wave clear you can farm up SS quickly and give your ult some more umph.

Yes. It should also be noted than the on-hit effects and the crit will also increase the damage his barrels do, so you can Q a barrel with a sheen proc and instantly clear the backline minions really easily.

Um... that sounds a bit too strong, I could be wrong about that though.
I mean, imagine {{item:3100}} and stacking AP and then dropping it on a full wave through your barrels. o.0
lich bane and runeglaive do not proc on it. only the physical sheens do.

Keep in mind your barrels, cause everyone else seems to think that your forgetting them.

His Barrels Augment your attack, dealing it's physical damage in an AoE. Applying On hit effects like sheen, and can critically strike. And gives you the Parley gold if it kills minions. 

You should have no problem clearing wave, once you have Tri Force, Maxed your Q, and maybe one other damage item. After which You should be able to build Health and CDR, to increase your ability to fight. 

Lastly keep in mind that his Barrels reset his passive. You should have no problem using his Barrels and Harassing you lane opponent at the same time. 

It may be difficult to get your first upgrade, but it will accelerate when you get latter into the game.

The barrels don't actually apply on hit effects(for example, they don't apply life steal) but apply the attack's (the attack that detonates them) damage. This means if the actual attack would've critted or would've applied Spellblade(Sheen's passive) it would do that damage(unless it's magical damage).

Here is something I posted earlier. Build ravenous hydra and farm away with your barrels and poke at the same time. 
The main point is rush HYDRA before anything else.

http://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/tips-tricks/EwnNmvft-gangplanks-ult-upgrades-and-the-silver-serpent-cost

The above note works. Something else to consider is that you get stacks very slowly at the start until you get some AD going where your barrels can wipe an entire wave of minions (might take 1-2 melee autos on them to get them low enough before barrel depending at what point in the game) and then Q your barrel to get an entire wave of stacks at once. In general, using barrels which ignore 60% of armor and do good dmg and can be modified by Sheen/Crits are a good way to stack them and harass and if you are getting multiple SS from a single barrel parley this means more up-time for Q to focus on the enemy.

Again, I will note that in my experience GP does not farm SS very fast early. In fact, I can get the other 1000 SS in a much shorter period of time than I could the initial 500 and still have time to spare simply because you stack them so much faster later as you get more AD/Crits/Sheen/TF and more barrels are available regularly (CD, etc.). You could simply opt for Q harass and ignoring Q SS farming until mid game and then swap to wiping entire waves with a 2 barrel combo for SS and harass with Q then.

New GP is a noob-trap in general... I have so much fun playing against him in lane now versus him being a moderate threat before if you knew how to play him
Ult upgrade is a luxury. You are supposed to get just one in most games

I don't consider Parrley + barrel to be a thing until you have trinity force + another AD item.

It's ridiculously hard to time the barrels early on because anyone with a brain can beat you to attacking it if they know your going to shoot right as it ticks to the last hp. You're basically just feeding them 10g and burning your Q cd. 

New GP barrels are borderline useless in lane except running away. I think it's a fun mechanic but its definitely not a "mini game" as the preview describes it

You're using them wrong then. You place one barrel on your side of the wave and let it tick down, then you quickly place another just within chain range then Q the first one. Since the low health barrel is close to you they have to get very close to you and take harass to destroy it, and when it explodes it destroys the 2nd barrel which you can place for waveclear or for harass.

> [{quoted}](name=kile147,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=fz0xgVTp,comment-id=000a0000,timestamp=2015-07-26T02:13:29.141+0000)

Since the low health barrel is close to you they have to get very close to you and take harass to destroy it, and when it explodes it destroys the 2nd barrel which you can place for waveclear or for harass.

But you often get left in the situation where they walk out of both circles, and unless you just want to push your lane, you're hurting your chances to last hit.

Without being able to 1 shot a minion with Q, I find it quite difficult to time waves correctly. Especially when an enemy is harassing you or trying to target barrels. 

Against a ranged champ the barrels are an absolute joke - they can generally shoot faster with less delay and the same range.

You can activate the second barrel faster than anyone can walk out if you place it on them, but I agree that they are too easy to destroy for enemy ranged champs. This is one of those cases where melees need an advantage, maybe ranged champs should have to take an extra shot on barrels?

Or maybe GP is just supposed to be stronger against melee than against ranged, like Darius.  Or even if Riot didn't specifically intend that, they might decide that it's OK (with or without eating an orange first) if his overall power level is reasonable.

I guess if that's the decision they made that's fine, but there are already plenty of champs out there who have a clear advantage over melees and they don't really need another counter. Also Gangplank is underperforming pretty heavily right now, with only a 42% win rate. While I think that shouldn't fully be trusted (still getting used to him),  I think a small buff like this would not make him broken.
It wouldn't be a buff for GP it'd be a nerf for ranged champs fighting him.

They aren't being changed at all and those other champs are not losing strength relative to anyone other than Gangplank. It's all relative so you can call it what you want, but I don't see why you'd call a change that makes one specific champ stronger against a certain type of opponent in a specific way a nerf to the opponents. Especially when it's Gangplank's kit that is being changed.

Just for clarity I'm saying it's worth trying, and think it would work well. How well it will work I can't say for certain at any given MMR, for all I know it'll fail.
